metadata.titleEn: A database of radiogenic Sr-Nd isotopes at the "three poles”
metadata.titleCn: 三极雪冰粉尘锶-钕同位素数据集
metadata.description: The radiogenic isotope composition of strontium (Sr) and neodymium (Nd) on surface of the Earth are a powerful tool for tracing dust sources and sinks on surface of the Earth. To differentiate the spatial variability of aeolian dust sources in key cryospheric regions at the three poles (including the ‘Third Pole’ covering the high mountain area in Asia, the Arctic and Antarctica). A dataset of the Sr-Nd isotopic compositions from the terrestrial extremely cold or arid environments in this study was compiled as the similar method by Blanchet (2019). The database identified on snow, ice, sand, soil (loess) and sediment from the modern dust samples and paleoclimatic records of the three poles based on 43 different references with 967 data points in total. There are 274 data points from the third pole, 302 data points from the Arctic, and 391 data points from Antarctica. The sampling and measurement methods, and quality of these data are recognized and introduced. In each pole, geographical coordinates and other information are provided. The main scientific purpose of this dataset is to provide our own measurement and collect documentation of the Sr-Nd dataset, which will be useful for determining the sources and transport pathways of dust at the three poles and to investigate whether there are multiple dust sources for each of the poles. These datasets provide detail exhaustive documentation of the isotopic signature from the three poles at specific time intervals, which would be useful for understanding the dust source or sink of the three poles.
metadata.descriptionCn: 本数据集主要包括了在三极（南极、北极和第三极）雪冰样品中粉尘的锶（Sr）-钕（Nd）同位素数据，也包括全球主要沙漠区样品锶-钕同位素数据。放射性锶-钕同位素比值被认为是示踪地球表层粉尘溯源的主要地球化学手段。因此，作者通过自主测试和文献收集的方式整合了地球三极寒区旱区锶-钕同位素数据集。数据包括来自雪冰、沙漠、土壤、黄土和沉积物等样品，时间分辨率主要包括现代和过去不同时间尺度；每个数据给出了具体的获取位置。数据集包括967个数据，其中391个数据来自南极，302个数据来自北极和274个数据来自第三极。数据处理使用了相同的计算方法，数据的测试方法大多用热电离质谱仪测试，数据质量均达到了使用的最低标准。该数据集主要的科学目标将有助于理解不同时间尺度粉尘在三极雪冰中的溯源和传输路径，揭示三极雪冰粉尘的多源性。数据集主要用于雪冰（冰芯）、黄土和海洋沉积物等专业方向，也可以对三极地区大气环流时空变化特征、大气化学传输模式验证和地球环境变化演化等领域。
metadata.instructions: The data is obtained in different areas of the three poles and entered in Excel. The data is taken as library name+location+test variable+compilation, and opened in Excel.
metadata.instructionsCn: 数据在三极不同区域获取，使用Excel录入。数据采取库名+位置+测试变量+编撰等，使用Excel打开。

background: The role of mineral dust in the Earth system extends well beyond its impact on the energy balance and involves interactions with the carbon cycle and glacier melting on global scales. The isotopic compositions of the radiogenic elements strontium (Sr) and neodymium (Nd) are powerful tools for tracing dust sources and sinks because their characteristics vary significantly on the surface of the Earth (including snow, sand, sediment, loess, and eolian deposits). Therefore, the combination of different isotopic signatures, specifically 87Sr/86Sr and 143Nd/144Nd (expressed as εNd(0)), has proven to be useful in discriminating among different dust source areas in Earth science. The transport of eolian dust from natural desert regions has also been identified in modern snow and ice records at the so-called “third pole” based on Sr–Nd data. However, it is still a controversial issue; for example, recent results have emphasized that eolian dust from local sources contributes significantly to high-mountain glaciers. Additionally, eolian dust from various source regions, including the Saharan Desert in North Africa and the Gobi and Taklimakan deserts in Asia, can be transported to the GrIS, and great uncertainties still exist. The Sr–Nd data from snow layers in the Berkner Island ice sheet in western Antarctica, for most of the year, support scenarios that involve contributions from proximal sources. The Sr–Nd data from insoluble dust in snow samples from East Antarctica indicate that long-distance natural dust primarily originates from Australia and that local dust originates from ice-free areas. The Sr–Nd data from Holocene ice cores from East Antarctica indicate a well-mixed atmospheric background involving a mixture of two or more sources in the Southern Hemisphere. The amount of isotopic information is currently adequate for Patagonian and non-Patagonian mineral dust exported from southern South America (SSA) and the East Antarctic ice sheet (EAIS). However, Sr–Nd data are unevenly distributed across the entire AIS. Measuring the Sr–Nd isotopic compositions in ice cores from Antarctica is a major challenge. Although considerable Sr–Nd data have been measured, the variations in the characteristics and measurement methods of these data make it necessary to reassess these data on the dust sources in these remote regions.
research objective: The main scientific purpose of this dataset is to provide a Sr–Nd dataset based on collective documentation and our own measurements, which will be useful for determining the sources and transport pathways of dust in snow, ice, rivers, and oceans at or near the three poles as well as to investigate whether multiple dust sources are present at each of the poles. The objective of this work was to produce a compilation of published and unpublished data from the three poles, and the specific time intervals of Sr–Nd data were limited to the Quaternary period.
challenges: The transport of dust from the low midlatitudes, which contain major deserts that are dust sources, to the Arctic region or Antarctic ice sheet (AIS) is sensitive to amplified high-latitude climatic variability. However, it is still a controversial issue; for example, recent results have emphasized that eolian dust from local sources contributes significantly to high-mountain glaciers. Additionally, eolian dust from various source regions, including the Saharan Desert in North Africa and the Gobi and Taklimakan deserts in Asia, can be transported to the GrIS, and great uncertainties still exist. Measuring the Sr–Nd isotopic compositions in ice cores from Antarctica is a major challenge. The answers to various questions have been hindered by a paucity of Sr–Nd data, which provide information on potential local and distal dust sources.
methods: For these reasons, we measured Sr–Nd data in some samples and collected Sr–Nd data from the literature for the three poles.
dataset: The database includes Holocene and Quaternary snow, ice, sand, soil (loess), sediment, and rock samples from the three poles based on 90 different references and our own measurement data, with a total of 1989 data points, comprising 206 data points with different grain sizes and 212 data points with fraction measurements. There are 485 data points from the third pole, 727 data points from the Arctic, and 777 data points from Antarctica.
backgroundCn: 矿物尘埃在地球系统中的作用远不止于其对能量平衡的影响，还涉及与碳循环和全球冰川融化的相互作用。放射性元素锶（Sr）和钕（Nd）的同位素组成是追踪尘埃源和汇的强大工具，因为它们的特征在地球表面（包括雪、沙、沉积物、黄土和风成沉积物）上有显著差异。因此，特定的不同同位素特征组合，特别是87Sr/86Sr和143Nd/144Nd（表示为εNd(0)），在地球科学中证明对区分不同尘埃源区域非常有用。从自然沙漠地区运输的风成尘埃在现代雪和冰记录中也被识别出，尤其是在所谓的“第三极”，基于Sr–Nd数据。然而，这仍然是一个有争议的问题；例如，最近的结果强调，来自地方源的风成尘埃对高山冰川的贡献显著。此外，来自多个源区域的风成尘埃，包括北非的撒哈拉沙漠和亚洲的戈壁沙漠及塔克拉玛干沙漠，可以被运输到格陵兰冰盖（GrIS），而且仍然存在很大的不确定性。来自西南极洲伯克纳岛冰盖的雪层中的Sr–Nd数据在大部分时间内支持来自近源的贡献场景。来自东南极洲雪样中不溶性尘埃的Sr–Nd数据表明，远距离自然尘埃主要来源于澳大利亚，而地方尘埃则来源于无冰区域。来自东南极洲全新世冰芯的Sr–Nd数据表明，南半球的气氛背景是良好混合的，涉及两种或更多源的混合。目前，关于来自南美洲南部（SSA）和东南极冰盖（EAIS）的巴塔哥尼亚和非巴塔哥尼亚矿物尘埃的同位素信息量已足够。然而，整个南极洲冰盖（AIS）的Sr–Nd数据分布不均。测量南极冰芯中的Sr–Nd同位素组成是一个重大挑战。尽管已经测量了大量的Sr–Nd数据，但这些数据的特征和测量方法的变化使得有必要重新评估这些遥远地区的尘埃源数据。
research objectiveCn: 该数据集的主要科学目的是提供一个基于集体文献和我们自己测量的Sr–Nd数据集，这将有助于确定在三个极地附近或极地的雪、冰、河流和海洋中尘埃的来源和运输路径，并调查每个极地是否存在多个尘埃来源。该工作的目标是编制来自三个极地的已发表和未发表数据的汇编，Sr–Nd数据的具体时间范围限于更新世时期。
challengesCn: 来自低中纬度地区的尘埃运输，这些地区包含主要沙漠作为尘埃源，向北极地区或南极冰盖（AIS）的运输对高纬度气候变异的放大非常敏感。然而，这仍然是一个有争议的问题；例如，最近的研究结果强调，来自当地源的风成尘埃对高山冰川的贡献显著。此外，来自多个源区域的风成尘埃，包括北非的撒哈拉沙漠以及亚洲的戈壁沙漠和塔克拉玛干沙漠，可以被运输到格陵兰冰盖（GrIS），而且仍然存在很大的不确定性。在南极冰芯中测量锶-铕同位素组成是一个主要挑战。由于锶-铕数据的稀缺，各种问题的答案受到阻碍，这些数据提供了潜在的局部和远源尘埃来源的信息。
methodsCn: 因此，我们对一些样本进行了Sr–Nd数据测量，并从文献中收集了三个极地的Sr–Nd数据。
datasetCn: 该数据库包括来自三个极地的全新世和第四纪的雪、冰、沙、土壤（黄土）、沉积物和岩石样本，基于90个不同的参考文献和我们自己的测量数据，总共有1989个数据点，其中包括206个不同粒径的数据点和212个分级测量的数据点。第三极有485个数据点，北极有727个数据点，南极有777个数据点。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a method used to measure Sr-Nd isotopic compositions in snow and ice samples?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能提供一个用于测量雪和冰样品中锶-钕同位素组成的方法的例子吗？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a method used to measure Sr-Nd isotopic compositions in snow and ice samples is the use of thermal ionization mass spectrometry (TIMS), which ensures that the data quality meets the minimum standards for scientific use.
Example.AnswerCn: 测量雪和冰样品中锶-铈同位素组成的一种方法是使用热离子化质谱法（TIMS），这确保了数据质量符合科学使用的最低标准。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you highlight an example of a challenge in collecting Sr-Nd isotopic data from Antarctic ice cores?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否举例说明从南极冰芯中收集Sr-Nd同位素数据时面临的挑战？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a challenge in collecting Sr-Nd isotopic data from Antarctic ice cores is the difficulty in measuring these compositions due to the sparse distribution of the data across the entire Antarctic Ice Sheet, which complicates the assessment of dust sources in these remote regions.
Example.AnswerCn: 从南极冰芯中收集Sr-Nd同位素数据的一项挑战是，由于数据在整个南极冰盖上的分布稀疏，导致测量这些成分的困难，这使得在这些偏远地区评估尘埃来源变得复杂。

Feature Specification.QuestionCn: Sr-Nd同位素组成有哪些独特特征使其适合追踪极地地区的尘埃来源和汇？

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the significance of Sr–Nd isotopic compositions in tracing dust sources and sinks in Earth science?
Definition.QuestionCn: Sr-Nd同位素组成在地球科学中追踪尘埃来源和汇的意义是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: The isotopic compositions of the radiogenic elements strontium (Sr) and neodymium (Nd) are powerful tools for tracing dust sources and sinks because their characteristics vary significantly on the surface of the Earth, including snow, sand, sediment, loess, and eolian deposits.
Definition.AnswerCn: 放射性元素锶（Sr）和钕（Nd）的同位素组成是追踪尘埃来源和汇的重要工具，因为它们的特征在地球表面（包括雪、沙子、沉积物、黄土和风成沉积物）上有显著的变化。

Definition.QuestionEn: What challenges are associated with measuring Sr–Nd isotopic compositions in ice cores from remote regions?
Definition.QuestionCn: 测量来自偏远地区冰芯的Sr–Nd同位素组成面临哪些挑战？
Definition.AnswerEn: Measuring the Sr–Nd isotopic compositions in ice cores from remote regions like Antarctica is a major challenge due to the variations in the characteristics and measurement methods of these data, and the paucity of Sr–Nd data which provide information on potential local and distal dust sources.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在像南极这样的偏远地区，从冰芯中测量锶-钕同位素组成是一项重大挑战，因为这些数据的特征和测量方法存在差异，并且锶-钕数据的稀缺性提供了有关潜在局部和远端尘埃来源的信息。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does the compilation of Sr–Nd data from the three poles aim to achieve in terms of understanding dust transport pathways?
Definition.QuestionCn: 从三个极地汇编Sr-Nd数据旨在实现什么目标，以便理解尘埃传输路径？
Definition.AnswerEn: The compilation of Sr–Nd data aims to determine the sources and transport pathways of dust in snow, ice, rivers, and oceans at or near the three poles and investigate whether multiple dust sources are present at each of the poles.
Definition.AnswerCn: Sr–Nd 数据的汇编旨在确定在三个极地附近的雪、冰、河流和海洋中尘埃的来源和运输路径，并调查每个极地是否存在多个尘埃来源。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the methods of measuring Sr-Nd isotopic data in snow and ice samples compare between the different poles, in terms of challenges faced and data reliability?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在不同极地，测量雪和冰样品中的Sr-Nd同位素数据的方法比较面临的挑战和数据可靠性如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Measuring the Sr-Nd isotopic compositions in ice cores from Antarctica is a major challenge due to the variations in characteristics and measurement methods. The challenges include amplified climatic variability and the contribution of local dust sources to high-mountain glaciers. The reliability of data also varies with the uneven distribution of Sr-Nd data across the Antarctic ice sheet compared to more comprehensive data from other poles.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在南极冰芯中测量锶-钕同位素组成是一项重大挑战，原因在于特征和测量方法的变化。挑战包括气候变异性的加剧以及当地尘埃源对高山冰川的贡献。由于南极冰盖上锶-钕数据的分布不均，相较于其他极地更全面的数据，数据的可靠性也有所不同。

Comparison.QuestionEn: In what ways does the compilation of Sr-Nd data from published and unpublished sources contribute to understanding dust transport and sources at the three poles compared to solely using newly measured data?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 对已发布和未发布来源的Sr-Nd数据进行汇编，有助于理解三个极地的尘埃运输和来源，这与仅使用新测量的数据相比，有哪些贡献？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The compilation of Sr-Nd data from both published and unpublished sources provides a more comprehensive dataset that covers a wider range of samples and time intervals, enhancing the understanding of dust transport and sources at the three poles. This approach allows for a broader comparison and reassessment of existing data, addressing the uneven distribution and varied characteristics of Sr-Nd data across different regions, compared to relying solely on newly measured data which might be limited in scope and coverage.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 对已发布和未发布来源的Sr-Nd数据进行汇编，提供了一个更全面的数据集，涵盖了更广泛的样本和时间间隔，从而增强了对三极地区尘埃运输和来源的理解。这种方法允许对现有数据进行更广泛的比较和重新评估，解决了不同地区Sr-Nd数据分布不均和特征多样的问题，相较于仅依赖新测量的数据，这种方法在范围和覆盖面上更具优势。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What can be inferred about the challenges of measuring Sr–Nd isotopic compositions in polar ice cores, and how might these challenges affect the interpretation of dust sources in these regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 可以推断出，在极地冰芯中测量Sr-Nd同位素组成面临的挑战是什么，以及这些挑战如何影响对这些地区尘埃来源的解释？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Measuring Sr–Nd isotopic compositions in ice cores from Antarctica is a major challenge due to the variations in data characteristics and measurement methods. These challenges can affect the interpretation of dust sources because they may lead to uncertainties in identifying local and distal sources of eolian dust, significantly contributing to high-mountain glaciers and complicating the understanding of transport pathways.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 在南极冰芯中测量锶-钕同位素组成是一项重大挑战，因为数据特征和测量方法的变化可能影响结果的解释。这些挑战可能导致在识别风成尘埃的地方和远处来源时的不确定性，显著影响高山冰川，并使运输路径的理解变得复杂。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How might the integration of Sr–Nd isotopic data from diverse sources like snow, ice, and sediments at the three poles influence the understanding of dust transport pathways?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 整合来自南北极和第三极的雪、冰和沉积物的Sr-Nd同位素数据可能会如何影响对粉尘传输路径的理解？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The integration of Sr–Nd isotopic data from diverse sources like snow, ice, and sediments can provide a comprehensive view of dust transport pathways by highlighting the different isotopic signatures and their distribution across the poles. This approach allows researchers to trace dust transport from both local and distant sources, enhancing the understanding of dust origins and atmospheric circulation patterns.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 将来自雪、冰和沉积物的Sr–Nd同位素数据整合，可以提供对尘埃运输路径的全面视角，突出不同同位素特征及其在极地的分布。这种方法使研究人员能够追踪尘埃的来源，包括本地和远程来源，从而增强对尘埃起源和大气环流模式的理解。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes challenges in measuring Sr–Nd isotopic compositions in ice cores from Antarctica?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致在南极冰芯中测量Sr–Nd同位素组成的挑战的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The challenges in measuring Sr–Nd isotopic compositions in ice cores from Antarctica arise from the variations in characteristics and measurement methods of the data, as well as the scarcity of Sr–Nd data, which provide information on potential local and distal dust sources.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在测量来自南极冰芯的锶-铷同位素组成时，面临的挑战包括数据特征和测量方法的变化，以及锶-铷数据的稀缺性，这些数据提供了潜在的本地和远源尘埃来源的信息。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is there a need to reassess Sr–Nd data on dust sourcing in remote regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么需要重新评估遥远地区的Sr–Nd数据以确定尘埃来源？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The need to reassess Sr–Nd data on dust sourcing in remote regions is due to the considerable variations in characteristics and measurement methods of these data, making it necessary to revisit these data for understanding dust sources in these areas.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 重新评估遥远地区尘埃来源的Sr–Nd数据的必要性在于这些数据的特征和测量方法存在显著差异，因此有必要重新审视这些数据，以便更好地理解这些地区的尘埃来源。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the reasons for the uneven distribution of Sr–Nd data across the Antarctic ice sheet?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 南极冰盖上Sr–Nd数据分布不均匀的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The uneven distribution of Sr–Nd data across the Antarctic ice sheet may be attributed to the major challenge of measuring isotopic compositions in ice cores and the limited availability of data providing information on local and distal dust sources.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 南极冰盖上Sr–Nd数据的不均匀分布可能归因于测量冰芯中同位素组成的主要挑战，以及提供有关局部和远源尘埃来源的信息的数据有限。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the consequences of integrating Sr-Nd isotopic data from various global desert regions into studies of polar snow and ice samples?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 将来自全球沙漠地区的Sr-Nd同位素数据整合到极地雪和冰样本的研究中会产生什么后果？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating Sr-Nd isotopic data from various global desert regions into studies of polar snow and ice samples allows researchers to trace the sources and transport pathways of dust in these regions. It helps in understanding whether multiple dust sources are present at each of the poles, which is crucial for studying the impact of dust on the Earth's climate system and geochemical processes.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 将来自全球各个沙漠地区的锶-钕同位素数据整合到极地雪和冰样本的研究中，可以帮助研究人员追踪这些地区尘埃的来源和运输路径。这有助于了解每个极地是否存在多个尘埃来源，这对于研究尘埃对地球气候系统和地球化学过程的影响至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to compile a Sr–Nd dataset based on collective documentation and measurements for the three poles?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么基于对三极的集体文献和测量编制Sr–Nd数据集很重要？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The main scientific purpose of a Sr–Nd dataset is to determine the sources and transport pathways of dust in snow, ice, rivers, and oceans at or near the three poles, and to investigate whether multiple dust sources are present at each of the poles.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: Sr–Nd 数据集的主要科学目的是确定在或接近三极地区的雪、冰、河流和海洋中尘埃的来源和运输路径，并调查每个极地是否存在多个尘埃来源。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What objectives drive the collection of Sr–Nd data from literature and new measurements for the three poles?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 收集文献和新测量的Sr–Nd数据的目标是什么，涉及三个极地？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objective of collecting Sr–Nd data from literature and new measurements is to address the challenge of understanding the transport of dust from major desert regions to the Arctic and Antarctic regions, and to provide information on potential local and distal dust sources.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 收集Sr–Nd数据的目的是为了应对理解来自主要沙漠地区的尘埃运输到北极和南极地区的挑战，并提供有关潜在的局部和远源尘埃来源的信息。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can researchers integrate data from literature with their own measurements to create a comprehensive Sr–Nd isotopic dataset?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 研究人员如何将文献中的数据与自己的测量结果整合，以创建一个全面的Sr–Nd同位素数据集？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Researchers can integrate data by compiling published and unpublished Sr–Nd isotopic data from various sources, focusing on the Holocene and Quaternary periods. This involves collecting data from 90 different references, along with their own measurements, to ensure a wide coverage of samples from snow, ice, sand, soil, loess, sediment, and rock from the three poles.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 研究人员可以通过汇编来自各种来源的已发表和未发表的Sr–Nd同位素数据来整合数据，重点关注全新世和第四纪时期。这涉及从90个不同的参考文献中收集数据，以及他们自己的测量，以确保从三个极地的雪、冰、沙、土壤、黄土、沉积物和岩石中获得广泛的样本覆盖。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What challenges are faced in collecting and measuring Sr–Nd isotopic data from Antarctic ice cores, and how can these be addressed?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在收集和测量南极冰芯中的锶-铷同位素数据时面临哪些挑战，以及如何解决这些挑战？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: One major challenge is the sensitivity of dust transport to climatic variability, which affects the interpretation of Sr–Nd isotopic data. Additionally, measuring isotopic compositions in ice cores is technically demanding. Addressing these challenges requires improving data collection techniques, ensuring consistent measurement methods, and expanding the Sr–Nd dataset to cover more regions and time intervals, thereby providing a clearer understanding of local and distal dust sources.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 一个主要挑战是尘埃运输对气候变化的敏感性，这影响了对Sr–Nd同位素数据的解释。此外，在冰芯中测量同位素组成技术上具有挑战性。解决这些挑战需要改进数据收集技术，确保测量方法的一致性，并扩展Sr–Nd数据集，以覆盖更多地区和时间间隔，从而提供对局部和远程尘埃源的更清晰理解。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What methods enable the integration of both self-measured and literature-based Sr-Nd isotopic data to form a comprehensive dataset for polar regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些方法可以将自我测量的和文献基础的Sr-Nd同位素数据整合在一起，以形成极地地区的综合数据集？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The integration of both self-measured and literature-based Sr-Nd isotopic data is enabled by a combination of direct measurements using techniques like thermal ionization mass spectrometry and the collection of data from existing literature. This approach allows for the creation of a comprehensive dataset covering various sample types, such as snow, ice, sand, soil, loess, sediment, and rock across the three poles.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 自测和文献基础的Sr-Nd同位素数据的整合得益于直接测量技术（如热离子质谱）与现有文献数据的结合。这种方法使得能够创建一个涵盖三极地区各种样本类型（如雪、冰、沙、土壤、黄土、沉积物和岩石）的综合数据集。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What challenges are expected when measuring Sr-Nd isotopic compositions in ice cores from remote regions like Antarctica, and what factors might contribute to these challenges?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在测量来自偏远地区如南极的冰芯中的锶-铈同位素组成时，预计会面临哪些挑战，以及哪些因素可能导致这些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Measuring the Sr–Nd isotopic compositions in ice cores from Antarctica is a major challenge due to the variations in characteristics and measurement methods, and the uneven distribution of Sr–Nd data across the entire Antarctic Ice Sheet (AIS). Additionally, the transport of dust from various source regions to these remote areas involves great uncertainties.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在南极冰芯中测量锶-钕同位素组成是一项重大挑战，原因在于特征和测量方法的变化，以及整个南极冰盖（AIS）中锶-钕数据的不均匀分布。此外，来自不同源区的尘埃运输到这些偏远地区也存在很大的不确定性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the distribution of Sr-Nd data be uneven across different polar regions, and what are the potential implications for understanding dust sources and transport pathways?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么不同极地地区的Sr-Nd数据分布可能不均匀，这对理解尘埃来源和运输路径有什么潜在影响？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The distribution of Sr–Nd data is uneven across polar regions like the Antarctic Ice Sheet (AIS) due to the challenges in measuring these isotopic compositions and the complexities involved in tracing dust sources and sinks. This uneven distribution can hinder the comprehensive understanding of dust sources and transport pathways in these regions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: Sr–Nd数据在极地地区如南极冰盖（AIS）分布不均，原因在于测量这些同位素组成的挑战以及追踪尘埃源和汇的复杂性。这种不均匀分布可能会妨碍对这些地区尘埃源和运输路径的全面理解。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you assess the challenges associated with collecting Sr–Nd isotopic data from snow and ice samples, especially in remote and harsh environments like the poles?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估在极地等偏远和恶劣环境中收集雪和冰样品的Sr–Nd同位素数据所面临的挑战？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Collecting Sr–Nd isotopic data from snow and ice samples in remote and harsh environments such as the poles is challenging due to amplified high-latitude climatic variability and the difficulty in obtaining consistent data across different regions. There is also the challenge of distinguishing between local and distal dust sources, which adds complexity to data collection efforts.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在极地等偏远和恶劣环境中收集Sr–Nd同位素数据具有挑战性，因为高纬度气候变异性加剧，并且在不同地区获得一致数据的难度较大。此外，区分当地和远源尘埃来源的挑战也增加了数据收集工作的复杂性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In your view, what are the potential benefits and drawbacks of integrating published and unpublished Sr–Nd data from diverse sources to create a comprehensive dataset for studying dust transport pathways?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在您看来，整合来自不同来源的已发布和未发布的Sr–Nd数据以创建一个全面的数据集用于研究尘埃运输路径的潜在好处和缺点是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Integrating published and unpublished Sr–Nd data from diverse sources can enhance the comprehensiveness and utility of a dataset by providing a broader temporal and spatial coverage, which is beneficial for studying dust transport pathways. However, potential drawbacks include variability in data quality and measurement methods, which may necessitate reassessment to ensure consistency and reliability in interpreting dust sources and transport pathways.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 整合来自不同来源的已发布和未发布的Sr–Nd数据可以增强数据集的全面性和实用性，因为它提供了更广泛的时间和空间覆盖，这对研究尘埃运输路径是有益的。然而，潜在的缺点包括数据质量和测量方法的变异性，这可能需要重新评估以确保在解释尘埃来源和运输路径时的一致性和可靠性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I’m unsure about how the radiogenic isotopic compositions of strontium and neodymium are measured and utilized to trace dust sources.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定铷和钕的放射性同位素组成是如何测量和利用的，以追踪尘埃来源。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The isotopic compositions of strontium (Sr) and neodymium (Nd) are measured using methods such as thermal ionization mass spectrometry. These isotopic signatures, specifically 87Sr/86Sr and 143Nd/144Nd (expressed as εNd(0)), are used to trace and discriminate among different dust source areas due to the significant variation in their characteristics across the Earth's surface.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 锶（Sr）和钕（Nd）的同位素组成通过热离子质谱等方法进行测量。这些同位素特征，特别是87Sr/86Sr和143Nd/144Nd（表示为εNd(0)），用于追踪和区分不同的尘埃来源区域，因为它们在地球表面特征上存在显著差异。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand the challenges associated with measuring Sr–Nd isotopic compositions in ice cores from Antarctica.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不理解在南极冰芯中测量锶-铷同位素组成所面临的挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Measuring Sr–Nd isotopic compositions in ice cores from Antarctica presents challenges due to the variations in the characteristics and measurement methods of the data. There is also a paucity of Sr–Nd data, which hinders understanding of potential local and distal dust sources, making it necessary to reassess existing data to provide accurate information on dust sources.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在南极冰芯中测量锶-钕同位素组成面临挑战，因为数据的特征和测量方法存在差异。此外，锶-钕数据的稀缺性阻碍了对潜在的局部和远源尘埃来源的理解，因此有必要重新评估现有数据，以提供关于尘埃来源的准确信息。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don’t understand how different isotopic signatures can help identify multiple dust sources at the three poles.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白不同的同位素特征如何帮助识别三个极地的多个尘埃来源。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Different isotopic signatures, such as 87Sr/86Sr and εNd(0), are useful in identifying multiple dust sources because they vary significantly on the Earth's surface and can therefore trace the movement and origin of dust particles. This tracing is crucial for understanding the sources and transport pathways of dust in snow, ice, and other samples from the three poles.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 不同的同位素特征，如87Sr/86Sr和εNd(0)，在识别多个尘埃来源方面非常有用，因为它们在地球表面变化显著，因此可以追踪尘埃颗粒的运动和来源。这种追踪对于理解来自三极地区的雪、冰和其他样本中的尘埃的来源和运输路径至关重要。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze and summarize the data collection techniques used for obtaining Sr-Nd isotopic compositions from snow, ice, and sediment samples across the three poles.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请分析和总结用于从三极的雪、冰和沉积物样本中获取Sr-Nd同位素组成的数据收集技术。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data collection techniques for obtaining Sr-Nd isotopic compositions involve both direct measurements using thermal ionization mass spectrometry and the compilation of data from existing literature. Samples are collected from snow, ice, sand, soil (loess), sediment, and rock across the three poles. The data collection is focused on ensuring consistency in the calculation methods and reaching the minimum quality standards required for scientific analysis.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 获取Sr-Nd同位素组成的数据收集技术包括使用热离子质谱法进行直接测量以及从现有文献中汇编数据。样本来自雪、冰、沙子、土壤（黄土）、沉积物和岩石，分布在三个极地。数据收集的重点是确保计算方法的一致性，并达到科学分析所需的最低质量标准。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore the challenges associated with measuring Sr-Nd isotopic compositions in ice cores from Antarctica and suggest potential solutions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨在南极冰芯中测量锶-钕同位素组成所面临的挑战，并提出潜在的解决方案。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: One of the main challenges in measuring Sr-Nd isotopic compositions in ice cores from Antarctica is the uneven distribution of data and the variations in data characteristics and measurement methods. A potential solution is to conduct more comprehensive and standardized measurements across different locations in Antarctica to reduce uncertainties and improve data comparability. Additionally, overcoming logistical challenges in sample collection and improving collaboration among research groups could help address these issues.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 测量来自南极冰芯的锶-钕同位素组成的主要挑战之一是数据分布不均以及数据特征和测量方法的变化。一个潜在的解决方案是在南极不同地点进行更全面和标准化的测量，以减少不确定性并提高数据可比性。此外，克服样本采集中的后勤挑战以及改善研究小组之间的合作也可以帮助解决这些问题。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please investigate potential data sources or strategies for expanding the existing Sr-Nd isotopic dataset to include more comprehensive coverage of dust transport pathways in the Arctic region.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请调查潜在的数据来源或策略，以扩展现有的Sr-Nd同位素数据集，以更全面地覆盖北极地区的尘埃运输路径。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: To expand the existing Sr-Nd isotopic dataset, one could focus on increasing the collection of samples from underrepresented areas in the Arctic, particularly those affected by high-latitude climatic variability. Collaborating with other researchers to share unpublished data and conducting new field studies in key regions, such as around major deserts that are significant dust sources, could also enhance dataset coverage. Additionally, improving the integration of data from different time periods, including the Holocene and Quaternary, will provide a more comprehensive understanding of dust transport pathways.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 为了扩展现有的Sr-Nd同位素数据集，可以重点增加来自北极地区的样本收集，特别是那些受到高纬度气候变化影响的地区。与其他研究人员合作，分享未发表的数据，并在关键区域进行新的实地研究，例如围绕重要的尘埃源的主要沙漠，这也可以增强数据集的覆盖范围。此外，改善来自不同时间段的数据整合，包括全新世和更新世，将提供对尘埃运输路径更全面的理解。
